book.occultism.dictionary_of_spirits.adv:
For more advanced rituals the basic [White Chalk](entry://occultism:dictionary_of_spirits/getting_started/ritual_prep@white_chalk)
is not sufficient. Instead chalks made from more arcane materials are required.
book.occultism.dictionary_of_spirits.cra:
The [](item://occultism:otherworld_goggles) give the wearer permanent [#](ad03fc)Third Eye[#](),
allowing to view even blocks hidden from those partaking of [](entry://occultism:dictionary_of_spirits/getting_started/demons_dream)
They will, however, not give the ability to harvest otherworld materials,
for this special tools or the use of Demon's Dream is required, depending on the type of material.

Otherworld Goggles make use of a [#](ad03fc)Foliot[#]() bound into the lenses.
The Foliot shares it's ability to view higher planes with the wearer, thus allowing them to see otherworld materials.
The required summoning is relatively simple, making crafting these goggles a common apprentice summoner task.

Binding rituals infuse spirits into items, where their powers are used for one specific purpose.
The created items can act like simple empowering enchantments, or fulfill complex tasks to aid the summoner.
book.occultism.dictionary_of_spirits.fam:
Familiar rituals summon spirits to aid the summoner directly.
The spirits usually inhabit an animal's body, allowing them to resist essence decay.
Familiars provide buffs, but may also actively protect the summoner.
book.occultism.dictionary_of_spirits.get: Cleaning up!
Chalk is a pain to clean up, by right-clicking with a brush you can remove it from the world much more easily.
Next Steps
Brush
Learn about the Otherworld and the Third Eye.

An additional side effect of Demon's Dream, is **the ability to interact with [#](ad03fc)Otherworld[#]() materials**.
This is unique to Demon's Dream, other ways to obtain [#](ad03fc)Third Eye[#]() do not yield this ability.
While under the effect of Demon's Dream you are able to **harvest** Otherstone as well as Otherworld trees.

Hidden from mere human eyes exists another plane of existence, another *dimension* if you will, the [#](ad03fc)Otherworld[#]().
This world is populated with entities often referred to as [#](ad03fc)Demons[#]().
The Otherworld

These Demons possess a wide variety of powers and useful skills, and for centuries magicians have sought to summon them for their own gain.
The first step on the journey to successfully summoning such an Entity is to learn how to interact with the Otherworld.
Lifting the Veil

Demon's Dream is a herb that gives humans the [#](ad03fc)Third Eye[#](),
allowing them to see where the [#](ad03fc)Otherworld[#]() intersects with our own.
Seeds can be found **by breaking grass**.
**Consuming** the grown fruit activates the ability.

The divination rod uses a spirit attuned gem attached to a wooden rod.
The gem resonates with the chosen material, and this movement is amplified by the wooden rod,
allowing to detect nearby Otherworld materials.    
    
    
The rod works by detecting resonance between real world and Otherworld materials.
Attuned the rod to a real world material, and it will find the corresponding Otherworld block.
Obtaining otherworld materials

Otherworld materials play an important role in interacting with spirits.
As they are rare and not visible to the naked eye, finding them requires special tools.
The divination rod allows to find Otherworld materials based on their similarities to materials common to our world.

White means nothing was found.
The more purple you see, the closer you are.

Shift-right-click a block to attune the rod to the corresponding Otherworld block.
- [](item://minecraft:andesite): [](item://occultism:otherstone)
- [](item://minecraft:oak_wood):  [](item://occultism:otherworld_log)
- [](item://minecraft:oak_leaves): [](item://occultism:otherworld_leaves)
- [](item://minecraft:netherrack): [](item://occultism:iesnium_ore)

Then right-click and hold until the rod animation finishes.
Use of the Rod

After the animation finishes, the closest **found block will be highlighted
with white lines and can be seen through other blocks**.
Additionally you can watch the crystals for hints: a white crystal indicates no target blocks found,
a fully purple block means the found block is nearby. Mixes between white and purple show
that the target is rather far away.

To make it easier to get started, the materials obtained by divination now also have crafting recipes.
**If you want the full experience, skip the following recipe page and move on to the
[divination instructions](entry://occultism:dictionary_of_spirits/getting_started/divination_rod@divination_instructions).**
Divination
Divination Rod

Otherworld Groves are lush, overgrown caves, with [#](ad03fc)Otherworld Trees[#](),
and walls of [](item://occultism:otherstone), and represent the fastest way to get everything one
needs to get set up as a summoner.
To find them, attune your divination rod to Otherworld leaves
or logs, as unlike Otherstone, they only spawn in these groves.
Otherworld Groves
**Hint:** In the Overworld, look **down**.

**Beware**: the tree growing from the sapling will look like a normal oak tree.
You need to activate the [Third Eye](entry://occultism:dictionary_of_spirits/getting_started/demons_dream)
to harvest the Otherworld Logs and Leaves.

Otherworld trees grow naturally in Otherworld Groves. To the naked eye they appear as oak trees,
but to the Third Eye they reveal their true nature.    
**Important:** Otherworld Saplings can only be obtained by breaking the leaves manually, naturally only oak saplings drop.
Otherworld Trees
Trees grown from Stable Otherworld Saplings as obtained from spirit traders do not have that limitation.

[Sacrificial Bowls](item://occultism:sacrificial_bowl) must be placed **anywhere**
within 8 blocks of the central [](item://occultism:golden_sacrificial_bowl).
The exact location does not matter.
\
\
Now it is time to place the ingredients you see on the next page in the (regular, not golden) sacrificial bowls.
We're actually getting started now!

These pages will walk the gentle reader through the process of the first ritual step by step.
We start by placing the golden sacrificial bowl and drawing the appropriate pentacle,
[#](ad03fc)Aviar's Circle[#]().
\
\
Next, place four sacrificial bowls close to the pentacle.
The Ritual (tm)
First Ritual

This page will show the ritual recipe in the future.
For now refer to the Old Edition to look up the
"Summon Foliot Crusher" ritual recipe.

Finally, right-click the golden sacrificial bowl with the **bound** book of binding
you created and wait until the crusher spawns.
\
\
Now all that remains is to drop appropriate ores near the crusher and wait for it to turn it into dust.
About using the Dictionary of Spirits

Occultism is transitioning from Patchouli to Modonomicon as in-game documentation.\
\
Currently only the "getting started" section is available in Modonomicon,
for all other content you need to refer back to the Patchouli book
titled "Dictionary of Spirits (Old Edition)".
Important Information

For now, to look up recipes, pentacle shapes, ritual information and basically everything after "getting started",
please open the Old Edition.\
\
Over time more and more content will be available directly here in the Modonomicon version.
Disclaimer!
To obtain the old edition, simply craft this book alone in a crafting grid. (The book new edition will not be destroyed.)
Getting Started
To infinity, and beyond!
Next Steps

For Now, please refer to the Old Edition's Getting Started section to learn more about next steps.
\
\
See also the [Disclaimer Entry](entry://occultism:dictionary_of_spirits/getting_started/intro).
Next Steps
Add the name of the spirit to summon to your book of binding by crafting it with the Dictionary of Spirits. The Dictionary will not be used up.
Craft a book of binding that will be used to call forth a [#](ad03fc)Foliot[#]() spirit.
Or how to identify your spirit

To call forth a spirit, a [#](ad03fc)Book of Binding[#]() must be used in the ritual.
There is a type of book corresponding to each type (or tier) of spirit.
To identify a spirit to summon, it's name must be written in the [#](ad03fc)Book of Binding[#](),
resulting in a [#](ad03fc)Bound Book of Binding[#]() that can be used in the ritual.
Books of Binding
Books of Binding

In order to craft [#](ad03fc)Books of Binding[#]() to summon spirits, you need purified ink.
Simply drop any black dye into [](item://occultism:spirit_fire) to purify it.
The brush can be used to easily remove chalk glyphs fom the ground.
Things to do before your first ritual.

This special sacrificial bowl is used to activate the ritual by right-clicking it with the activation item,
usually a book of binding, once everything has been set up and you are ready to start.

To summon spirits from the [#](ad03fc)Other Place[#]() in relative safety,
you need to draw a fitting pentacle using chalk to contain their powers.
Furthermore, you need [Sacrificial Bowls](item://occultism:sacrificial_bowl)
to sacrifice fitting items to attract the spirit.
Ritual Preparations
Ritual Preparations

These bowls are used to sacrifice items as part of a ritual and you will need a handful of them.
Note: Their exact placement in the ritual does not matter - just keep them within 8 blocks of the pentacle center!

Ingredient for candles. Kill large animals like pigs, cows or sheep with a [](item://occultism:butcher_knife)
to harvest [](item://occultism:tallow).

Candles provide stability to rituals and are an important part of almost all pentacles.
**Candles also act like bookshelves for enchantment purposes.**

For pentacles, only the color of chalk is relevant, not the glyph/sign.
For decorative purposes you can repeatedly click a block to cycle through glyphs.
For other chalks see [Chalks](entry://occultism:dictionary_of_spirits/advanced/chalks).
Or does it?

The main uses of [](item://occultism:spirit_fire) are to convert [](item://minecraft:diamond) into [](item://occultism:spirit_attuned_gem),
to get basic ingredients such as [](item://occultism:otherstone) and [Otherworld Saplings](item://occultism:otherworld_sapling_natural),
and to purify impure chalks.
It burns!
An easier way to obtain [](item://occultism:otherstone) than via divination.
An easier way to obtain [Otherworld Saplings](item://occultism:otherworld_sapling_natural) than via divination.
Throw [](item://occultism:datura) to the ground and light it on fire with [](item://minecraft:flint_and_steel).

[#](ad03fc)Spiritfire[#]() is a special type of fire that exists mostly in [#](ad03fc)The Other Place[#]()
and does not harm living beings. Its special properties allow to use it to purify and convert
certain materials by burning them, without consuming them.

The ability to see beyond the physical world is referred to as [#](ad03fc)Third Eye[#]().
Humans do not possess such an ability to see [#](ad03fc)beyond the veil[#](),
however with certain substances and contraptions the knowledgeable summoner can work around this limitation.
Third Eye
Do you see now?

The most comfortable, and most *expensive*, way to obtain this ability, is to wear spectacles
infused with spirits, that *lend* their sight to the wearer.
A slightly more nauseating, but **very affordable** alternative is the consumption of certain herbs,
[Demon's Dream](entry://occultism:dictionary_of_spirits/getting_started/demons_dream) most prominent among them.
The Third Eye

[These goggles](entry://occultism:dictionary_of_spirits/crafting_rituals/craft_otherworld_goggles) allow to see even more hidden Otherworld blocks,
however they do not allow harvesting those materials.
Low-tier materials can be harvested by consuming [Demon's Dream](entry://occultism:dictionary_of_spirits/getting_started/demons_dream),
but more valuable materials require special tools.
book.occultism.dictionary_of_spirits.pen: Golden chalk is used for binding runes, which allow to infuse a spirit into an item, or make it possess a living being.

Chalk is used to draw pentacle runes and define the pentacle shape.
Different types of chalk are used for different purposes, as outlined on the next pages. \
\
The different runes are purely decorative.

**Repeatedly** use chalk on a block to switch to a different rune. \
\
Using a [](item://occultism:brush) is the easiest way to **remove** chalk runes that have been incorrectly placed.

Purple chalk is generally used to call on higher beings such as [#](ad03fc)Djinn[#]() or [#](ad03fc)Afrit[#](),
but also slows essence decay of summoned spirits.

Red chalk is used to call on the most powerful and dangerous beings, such as [#](ad03fc)Marid[#](). \
\
[Afrit Essence]() is required to craft red chalk.

White chalk is the most basic type of ritual chalk and is found in most pentacles.
It has no special power beyond defining the shape of the pentacle.

**Purpose:** Bind Afrit
\
\
First discovered by Grandmistress Sevira of Emberwoods, **Sevira's Permanent Confinement** is used for binding [#](ad03fc)Afrit[#]() into objects.
Due to the power of the spirits involved, this should be performed only by advanced summoners.

**Purpose:** Bind Djinni
\
\
**Strigeor's Higher Binding** is a pentacle for binding [#](ad03fc)Djinn[#]() into objects, should not be attempted by the novice summoner.
Supported by spirit attuned crystals and stabilized by candles it is highly suitable for permanent infusions of objects with spirits.

**Purpose:** Bind Foliot
\
\
As a simple binding pentacle, **Eziveus' Spectral Compulsion** is a common starting point for object infusion with lower spirits.
The enchantment is made permanent by stabilizing candles and spirit attuned crystals.

**Purpose:** Bind Marid
\
\
**Uphyxes Inverted Tower** is one of the few pentacles capable of binding [#](ad03fc)Marid[#]() into objects.
Any rituals involving [#](ad03fc)Marid[#]() should be performed only by the most experienced summoners.

Candles increase the stability of the pentacle, thus allowing a slowed essence decay of the summoned spirit,
leading to a longer lifetime of the spirit, or possessed object or being.
Crystals increase the binding power of the pentacle, allowing a permanent binding of the spirit into an item or living being.
In addition to runes various occult paraphernalia are used to improve the intended effect of the pentacle.
Skulls increase the calling power of the pentacle, allowing to summon more dangerous spirits.

[Sacrificial Bowls](item://occultism:sacrificial_bowl) must be placed **anywhere**
within 8 blocks of the central [](item://occultism:golden_sacrificial_bowl).
The exact location does not matter.
\
\
Now it is time to place the ingredients you see on the next page in the (regular, not golden) sacrificial bowls.

Infusion pentacles allow the binding of spirits into objects.
While the spirits suffer from essence decay in some cases,
this can often be averted with the right pentacle setup,
and by embedding crystals and precious metals into the object to support the spirit.

The name [#](ad03fc)Pentacle[#]() in this context refers to ritual drawings of any shape, not just five-pointed stars. \
\
Pentacles are used to summon and bind spirits from [#](ad03fc)The Other Place[#]().

They act both as a device to call on the entity, an amplifier for the summoner's commanding power
and as a protecting circle preventing attacks from within against the summoner.

Each pentacle consists of a central golden sacrificial bowl, surrounding runes of various colors
and occult paraphernalia that improve the intended effect in various ways.

The combination of chosen runes and supporting items as well as their exact spatial positioning determines
the use and effectiveness of the pentacle. \
\
Ingredients are placed in [#](ad03fc)Sacrifical Bowls[#]() near the pentacle.

These pentacles force spirits to possess a living being, which, depending on the ritual context,
gives the summoner control over various aspects of that being, ranging from it's strength to it
what it drops when killed, and in some cases even allows total control.

The purpose of this type of pentacle is to summon spirits in their chosen form into the world.
Spirits summoned thus suffer from strong essence decay, and only very powerful spirits can
remain for extended periods of time.

**Purpose:** Afrit Possession
\
\
**Abras' Commanding Conjure** is a modified version of [#](ad03fc)Abras' Conjure[#]() that allows possessing entities, and thus summoning familiars.

**Purpose:** Djinni Possession
\
\
**Ihagan's Enthrallment** forces [#](ad03fc)Djinn[#]() to possess a nearby creature.
This pentacle does not lead to permanent imprisonment, the spirit and possessed creature will perish within a short period of time.

**Purpose:** Foliot Possession
\
\
**Hedyrin's Lure** attracts [#](ad03fc)Foliot[#]() and forces them to possess a nearby creature.
This pentacle does not lead to permanent imprisonment, the spirit and possessed creature will perish within a short period of time.

**Purpose:** Summon an [#](ad03fc)Afrit[#]()
\
\
**Abras' Conjure** is one of the few pentacles capable of (mostly) safely summoning an [#](ad03fc)Afrit[#]().
While the requirement of a wither skeleton skull makes it comparatively expensive, the additional calling potential is required to reach these high-power spirits.

**Purpose:** Summon a [#](ad03fc)Djinni[#]()
\
\
Developed by [#](ad03fc)Ophyx[#]() during the Third Era, the [#](ad03fc)Calling[#]() is the go-to pentacle for [#](ad03fc)Djinni[#]() summonings ever since.
Skeleton skulls ([Obtain here]()) and [#](ad03fc)Purple Chalk[#]() provide the calling power required to force Djinni into appearance and candles stabilize the ritual.

**Purpose:** Summon a [#](ad03fc)Foliot[#]()
 \
 \
 Considered by most to be the simplest pentacle, [#](ad03fc)Aviar's Circle[#]() is easy to set up,
 but provides only a minimum of binding power and protection for the summoner.
 \
 \
Only the weakest [#](ad03fc)Foliot[#]() can be summoned in rituals using this pentacle.

**Purpose:** Summon a [#](ad03fc)Marid[#]()
\
\
**Fatma's Incentivized Attraction** is a powerful pentacle, allowing to summon [#](ad03fc)Marid[#]() and bind them to the summoner's will.

**Purpose:** Summon an unbound [#](ad03fc)Afrit[#]()
\
\
**Abras' Open Conjure** is a simplified version of [#](ad03fc)Abras' Conjure[#](), allowing to summon [#](ad03fc)Afrit[#]() without red chalk.
Due to the much reduced power of the pentacle, it cannot be used to control [#](ad03fc)Afrit[#](), and it thus can only be used to fight and kill [#](ad03fc)Afrit[#]().

**Purpose:** Summon an unbound [#](ad03fc)Greater Spirit[#]()
\
\
**Osorin's Unbound Calling** is based on [#](ad03fc)Abras' Open Conjure[#](), but features none of the stabilizing paraphernalia.
The pentacle offers no protection whatsoever to the summoner, but acts as an irresistible call to [#](ad03fc)Greater Spirits[#]().
book.occultism.dictionary_of_spirits.pos:
Possession rituals bind spirits into living beings,
giving the summoner a degree of control over the possessed being.
This can range from controlling their item drops to forcing them to do the summoner's bidding.
book.occultism.dictionary_of_spirits.rit:
Some rituals require the use of certain items to be performed.
Use the item described on the ritual's page within **16 blocks** of the
[](item://occultism:golden_sacrificial_bowl) to proceed with the ritual.
\
\
**Important:** Before using the item, start the ritual. Grey particles indicate that the ritual is ready for the item use.

If a ritual shows grey particles above the golden sacrificial bowl,
then additional requirements as described in the ritual's page need to be fulfilled.
Once all requirements are fulfilled, the ritual will show purple particles and start to consume the items in the sacrificial bowls.

Rituals allow to summon spirits into our plane of existence, or bind them into objects or living beings.
Every ritual consists of a [#](ad03fc)Pentacle[#](),
[#](ad03fc)Ritual Ingredients[#]() provided via sacrificial bowls,
a [#](ad03fc)Starting Item[#]()
and optionally the [#](ad03fc)Sacrifice[#]() of living beings.
A purple particle effect will show that the ritual is successful and in progress.

Rituals always follow the same steps:
- Draw the pentacle.
- Place a golden bowl.
- Place sacrificial bowls.
- Put ingredients in bowls.
- Right-click the golden bowl with the activation item.
- *Optional: Perform a sacrifice close to the center of the pentacle.*

Some rituals require the sacrifice of a living being to provide the necessary energy to summon the spirit.
Sacrifices are described on the ritual's page under the "Sacrifice" subheading.
To perform a sacrifice, kill an animal within 8 blocks of the golden sacrificial bowl.
Only kills by players count as sacrifice!
book.occultism.dictionary_of_spirits.sum:
Summon rituals force spirits to enter this world in their chosen shape,
leading to little restrictions on their power, but expose them to essence decay.
Summoned spirits range from trade spirits that trade and convert items, to slave-like helpers for manual labour.
book.occultism.dictionary_of_spirits.too:
This book aims to introduce the novice reader to the most common summoning rituals and equip them with a list of spirits and their names.
The authors advise caution in the summoning of the listed entities.
For help or to give feedback please join us in Discord https://invite.gg/klikli.
book.occultism.name: Dictionary of Spirits (Old Edition)
gui.occultism.spirit.transporter.tag_fil:
Enter the tags to filter for separated by ";".
E.g.: "forge:ores;*logs*".
Use "*" to match any character, e.g. "*ore*" to match ore tags from any mod. To filter for items, prefix the item id with "item:", E.g.: "item:minecraft:chest".
Do not sync search with JEI.
Clear the text with a right-click.

item.occultism.jei_dummy.none.tooltip: This ritual does not create any items.
item.occultism.jei_dummy.require_item_us: This ritual requires to use a specific item to start. Please refer to the Dictionary of Spirits for detailed instructions.

Allows miner spirits to enter the mining dimension and bring back resources.
item.occultism.ritual_dummy.craft_famili: The familiar ring allows to store familiars. The ring will apply the familiar effect to the wearer.
item.occultism.ritual_dummy.craft_infuse: These lenses are used to craft spectacles that give thee ability to see beyond the physical world.
item.occultism.ritual_dummy.craft_miner_: Summon Djinni Ore Miner into a magic lamp.
Summon Foliot Miner into a magic lamp.
item.occultism.ritual_dummy.craft_satche: This satchels allows to store more items than it's size would indicate, making it a practical traveller's companion.
item.occultism.ritual_dummy.craft_soul_g: The soul gem allows the temporary storage of living beings.
item.occultism.ritual_dummy.craft_stabil: The storage stabilizer allows to store more items in the dimensional storage accessor.
The storage stabilizer allows to store more items in the dimensional storage accessor.
The storage stabilizer allows to store more items in the dimensional storage accessor.
The storage stabilizer allows to store more items in the dimensional storage accessor.
item.occultism.ritual_dummy.craft_stable: The stable wormhole allows access to a dimensional matrix from a remote destination.
item.occultism.ritual_dummy.craft_storag: The storage actuator base imprisons a Foliot responsible for interacting with items in a dimensional storage matrix.
The Storage Accessor can be linked to a Storage Actuator to remotely access items.
item.occultism.ritual_dummy.custom_ritua: Used for modpacks as a fallback for custom rituals that do not have their own ritual item.
item.occultism.ritual_dummy.familiar_bat: Bat familiars provide night vision to their master.
item.occultism.ritual_dummy.familiar_bea: The Beaver familiar provides increased woodcutting speed to their masters and harvests nearby trees when they grow from a sapling.
item.occultism.ritual_dummy.familiar_beh: The beholder familiars highlight nearby entities with a glow effect and shoot laser rays at enemies.
item.occultism.ritual_dummy.familiar_bla: The blacksmith familiars take stone their master mines and uses it to repair equipment.
item.occultism.ritual_dummy.familiar_chi: The chimera familiars can be fed to grow in size and gain attack speed and damage. Once big enough, playeres can ride them.
item.occultism.ritual_dummy.familiar_cth: The cthulhu familiars provide water breathing to their master.
item.occultism.ritual_dummy.familiar_dee: Deer familiars provide jump boost to their master.
item.occultism.ritual_dummy.familiar_dev: The devil familiars provide fire resistance to their master.
item.occultism.ritual_dummy.familiar_dra: The dragon familiars provide increased experience gain to their master.
item.occultism.ritual_dummy.familiar_fai: The fairy familiar keeps other familiars from dying, drains enemies of their life force and heals its master and their familiars.
item.occultism.ritual_dummy.familiar_gre: Greedy familiars pick up items for their master. When stored in a familiar ring, they increase the pickup range (like an item magnet).
item.occultism.ritual_dummy.familiar_gua: The guardian familiars prevent their master's violent demise.
item.occultism.ritual_dummy.familiar_hea: The headless ratman familiars increase their master's attack damage against enemies of the kind it stole the head from.
item.occultism.ritual_dummy.familiar_mum: The Mummy familiar is a martial arts expert and fights to protect their master.
item.occultism.ritual_dummy.familiar_oth: Drikwings will provide their owner with limited flight abilities when nearby.
item.occultism.ritual_dummy.familiar_par: Parrot familiars behave exactly like tamed parrots.
item.occultism.ritual_dummy.possess_ende: The possessed Enderman will always drop at least one ender pearl when killed.
The possessed Endermite drops End Stone.
item.occultism.ritual_dummy.possess_ghas: The possessed Ghast will always drop at least one ghast tear when killed.
item.occultism.ritual_dummy.possess_skel: The possessed Skeleton is immune to daylight and always drop at least one Skeleton Skull when killed.
item.occultism.ritual_dummy.summon_afrit: The crusher is a spirit summoned to crush ores into dusts, effectively (more than) doubling the metal output. This crusher decays (much) slower than lower tier crushers.
Summons an bound Afrit that creates rain.
Summons an bound Afrit that creates a thunderstorm.
item.occultism.ritual_dummy.summon_djinn: Summons a Djinni that clears the weather.
The crusher is a spirit summoned to crush ores into dusts, effectively (more than) doubling the metal output. This crusher decays (much) slower than lower tier crushers.
Summons a Djinni that sets the time to high noon.
The machine operator automatically transfers items between Dimensional Storage Systems and connected Inventories and Machines.
Summons a Djinni that sets the time to midnight.
item.occultism.ritual_dummy.summon_folio: The janitor will pick up dropped items and deposit them into a target inventory.
The crusher is a spirit summoned to crush ores into dusts, effectively doubling the metal output.
The lumberjack will harvest trees in it's working area and deposit the dropped items into the specified chest.
The otherstone trader trades normal stone for otherstone.
he otherworld sapling trader trades natural otherworld saplings for stable ones, that can be harvested without the third eye.
The transporter will move all items it can access from one inventory to another, including machines.
item.occultism.ritual_dummy.summon_marid: The crusher is a spirit summoned to crush ores into dusts, effectively (more than) doubling the metal output. This crusher decays (much) slower than lower tier crushers.
item.occultism.ritual_dummy.summon_wild_: Summons an unbound Afrit that can be killed to obtain Afrit Essence
The Wild Hunt consists of Wither Skeletons that are guaranteed to drop Wither Skeleton Skulls, and their minions.
Summons a Drikwing Familiar that can be tamed by anyone, not just the summoner.
Summons a Parrot that can be tamed by anyone, not just the summoner.
item.occultism.soul_gem.message.entity_t: Soul gems cannot contain this type of being.
item.occultism.soul_gem.tooltip_empty: Use on a creature to capture it.
item.occultism.spawn_egg.wild_hunt_withe: Wild Hunt Wither Skeleton Spawn Egg
item.occultism.storage_remote.message.no: Chunk for storage actuator not loaded!
jei.occultism.error.pentacle_not_loaded: The pentacle could not be loaded.
jei.occultism.ingredient.datura.descript: Can be used to heal all spirits and familiars summoned by Occultism Rituals. Simply right-click the entity to heal it by one heart
jei.occultism.ingredient.iesnium_ore.des: Found in the nether. Only visible while the status §6Third§r §6Eye§r is active. See §6Dictionary§r §6of§r §6Spirits§r for more information.
jei.occultism.ingredient.otherstone.desc: Primarily found in Otherworld Groves. Only visible while the status §6Third Eye§r is active. See §6Dictionary of Spirits§r for more information.
jei.occultism.ingredient.otherworld_leav: Primarily found in Otherworld Groves. Only visible while the status §6Third Eye§r is active. See §6Dictionary of Spirits§r for more information.
Primarily found in Otherworld Groves. Only visible while the status §6Third Eye§r is active. See §6Dictionary of Spirits§r for more information.
jei.occultism.ingredient.otherworld_sapl: Primarily found in Otherworld Groves. Only visible while the status §6Third Eye§r is active. See §6Dictionary of Spirits§r for more information.
Primarily found in Otherworld Groves. Only visible while the status §6Third Eye§r is active. See §6Dictionary of Spirits§r for more information.
jei.occultism.ingredient.spirit_fire.des: Throw §6Demon's Dream  Fruit§r to the ground and light it on fire. See §6Dictionary of Spirits§r for more information.
jei.occultism.ingredient.tallow.descript: Kill animals, such as §2pigs§r, §2cows§r, §2sheep§r, §2horses§r and §2lamas§r with the Butcher Knife to obtain tallow.
ritual.occultism.book_not_bound: §lUnbound Book of Calling§r. You must craft this book with Dictionary of Spirits to bind to a spirit before starting a ritual.
